summary: Frontend-only testing completed for La Pulpería app. Verified landing page with red nebula effect, Pulpero component renaming, customization panel structure, and public pages. Protected routes (admin, dashboard, orders) correctly redirect to login when not authenticated.

issues: Design looks excellent with red nebula effect and floating particles working correctly
Page loads correctly with proper styling and log entries visible

action_items: ESLint warnings for useEffect dependencies in AnimatedBackground.js (line 76) and PulperiaDashboard.js (line 212) - not critical but should be addressed
critical_code_review_comments: ✅ Pulpero component (formerly Pulpito) correctly renamed with human-like Spanish messages for pending/accepted/ready states
✅ Pulpero component has proper SVG animations for each order status (searching, cooking with chef hat, celebrating)
✅ getPulperoMessage helper function exports correctly from Pulpito.js
✅ MyOrders.js correctly imports and uses Pulpero component with getPulperoMessage
✅ ShoppingCart.js has image support for products (lines 191-196)
✅ Header.js has notification dropdown with order status management for pulperia owners
✅ PulperiaDashboard customization panel has all required sections: Live Preview, Basic Info, Images (logo/banner), Location, Contact, Visual Style (colors/fonts)
✅ AdminPanel.js has password protection with 'AlEjA127' password
✅ AdminPanel correctly shows password dialog before loading admin content
⚠️ File naming: Component is named 'Pulpero' but file is still 'Pulpito.js' - consider renaming file for consistency
test_credentials: Admin password: AlEjA127, Admin email: onol4sco05@gmail.com (requires Google OAuth)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Frontend testing completed. All public pages work correctly. Protected routes require Google OAuth authentication. The Pulpero component (renamed from Pulpito) has human-like Spanish messages and animations for different order states. The customization panel in PulperiaDashboard has live preview, basic info, images, location, contact, and visual style sections. AdminPanel has password protection that shows before the admin content loads. ESLint warnings exist for useEffect dependencies but don't affect functionality.
